00028 /**
00029  * A persistent pool of Applications.
00030  *
00031  * Spawning Ruby on Rails application instances is a very expensive operation.
00032  * Despite best efforts to make the operation less expensive (see SpawnManager),
00033  * it remains expensive compared to the cost of processing an HTTP request/response.
00034  * So, in order to solve this, some sort of caching/pooling mechanism will be required.
00035  * ApplicationPool provides this.
00036  *
00037  * Normally, one would use SpawnManager to spawn a new RoR application instance,
00038  * then use Application::connect() to create a new session with that application
00039  * instance, and then use the returned Session object to send the request and
00040  * to read the HTTP response. ApplicationPool replaces the first step with
00041  * a call to Application::get(). For example:
00042  * @code
00043  *   ApplicationPool pool = some_function_which_creates_an_application_pool();
00044  *   
00045  *   // Connect to the application and get the newly opened session.
00046  *   Application::SessionPtr session(pool->get("/home/webapps/foo"));
00047  *   
00048  *   // Send the request headers and request body data.
00049  *   session->sendHeaders(...);
00050  *   session->sendBody(...);
00051  *
00052  *   // Now read the HTTP response.
00053  *   string responseData = readAllDataFromSocket(session->getReader());
00054  *
00055  *   // This session has now finished, so we close the session by resetting
00056  *   // the smart pointer to NULL (thereby destroying the Session object).
00057  *   session.reset();
00058  *
00059  *   // We can connect to an Application multiple times. Just make sure
00060  *   // the previous session is closed.
00061  *   session = app->connect("/home/webapps/bar")
00062  * @endcode
00063  *
00064  * Internally, Application::get() will keep spawned applications instances in
00065  * memory, and reuse them if possible. It will try to keep spawning to a minimum.
00066  * Furthermore, if an application instance hasn't been used for a while, it
00067  * will be automatically shutdown in order to save memory. And finally, one can
00068  * set a hard limit on the maximum number of applications instances that may be
00069  * spawned (see ApplicationPool::setMax()).
00070  *
00071  * Note that ApplicationPool is just an interface (i.e. a pure virtual class).
00072  * For concrete classes, see StandardApplicationPool and ApplicationPoolServer.
00073  *
00074  * @ingroup Support
00075  */
00076 class ApplicationPool {
00077 public:
00078         virtual ~ApplicationPool() {};
00079         
00080         /**
00081          * Open a new session with the application specified by <tt>appRoot</tt>.
00082          * See the class description for ApplicationPool, as well as Application::connect(),
00083          * on how to use the returned session object.
00084          *
00085          * @param appRoot The application root of a RoR application, i.e. the folder that
00086          *             contains 'app/', 'public/', 'config/', etc. This must be a valid
00087          *             directory, but does not have to be an absolute path.
00088          * @param user The user to run the application instance as.
00089          * @param group The group to run the application instance as.
00090          * @return A session object.
00091          * @note Applications are uniquely identified with the application root
00092          *       string. So although <tt>appRoot</tt> does not have to be absolute, it
00093          *       should be. If one calls <tt>get("/home/foo")</tt> and
00094          *       <tt>get("/home/../home/foo")</tt>, then ApplicationPool will think
00095          *       they're 2 different applications, and thus will spawn 2 application instances.
00096          */
00097         virtual Application::SessionPtr get(const string &appRoot, const string &user = "", const string &group = "") = 0;
00098         
00099         /**
00100          * Set a hard limit on the number of application instances that this ApplicationPool
00101          * may spawn. The exact behavior depends on the used algorithm, and is not specified by
00102          * these API docs.
00103          *
00104          * It is allowed to set a limit lower than the current number of spawned applications.
00105          */
00106         virtual void setMax(unsigned int max) = 0;
00107         
00108         /**
00109          * Get the number of active applications in the pool.
00110          *
00111          * This method exposes an implementation detail of the underlying pooling algorithm.
00112          * It is used by unit tests to verify that the implementation is correct,
00113          * and thus should not be called directly.
00114          */
00115         virtual unsigned int getActive() const = 0;
00116         
00117         /**
00118          * Get the number of active applications in the pool.
00119          *
00120          * This method exposes an implementation detail of the underlying pooling algorithm.
00121          * It is used by unit tests to verify that the implementation is correct,
00122          * and thus should not be called directly.
00123          */
00124         virtual unsigned int getCount() const = 0;
00125 };

00127 /**
00128  * A standard implementation of ApplicationPool. This implementation is to be used in a
00129  * single-process environment, which may or may not be multithreaded. For example, Apache
00130  * with the threading MPM (and <b>not</b> the prefork MPM).
00131  *
00132  * For multi-process environments, use ApplicationPoolServer instead.
00133  *
00134  * @warning
00135  *   StandardApplicationPool uses threads internally. Because threads disappear after a fork(),
00136  *   a StandardApplicationPool object will become unusable after a fork().
00137  *
00138  * @ingroup Support
00139  */
00140 class StandardApplicationPool: public ApplicationPool {
00141 private:
00142         static const int CLEAN_INTERVAL = 62;
00143         static const int MAX_IDLE_TIME = 60;
00144 
00145         typedef list<ApplicationPtr> ApplicationList;
00146         typedef shared_ptr<ApplicationList> ApplicationListPtr;
00147         typedef map<string, ApplicationListPtr> ApplicationMap;

00149         struct SharedData {
00150                 mutex lock;
00151                 condition countOrMaxChanged;
00152                 
00153                 ApplicationMap apps;
00154                 unsigned int max;
00155                 unsigned int count;
00156                 unsigned int active;
00157         };
00158         
00159         typedef shared_ptr<SharedData> SharedDataPtr;

00161         struct SessionCloseCallback {
00162                 SharedDataPtr data;
00163                 weak_ptr<Application> app;
00164                 
00165                 SessionCloseCallback(SharedDataPtr data, weak_ptr<Application> app) {
00166                         this->data = data;
00167                         this->app = app;
00168                 }
00169                 
00170                 void operator()(Application::Session &session) {
00171                         mutex::scoped_lock l(data->lock);
00172                         ApplicationPtr app(this->app.lock());
00173                         
00174                         if (app != NULL) {
00175                                 ApplicationMap::iterator it(data->apps.find(app->getAppRoot()));
00176                                 if (it != data->apps.end()) {
00177                                         if (app->getSessions() == 0) {
00178                                                 // TODO: make this operation constant time
00179                                                 it->second->remove(app);
00180                                                 it->second->push_front(app);
00181                                         }
00182                                         data->active--;
00183                                 }
00184                                 app->setLastUsed(time(NULL));
00185                         }
00186                 }
00187         };

00189         #ifdef PASSENGER_USE_DUMMY_SPAWN_MANAGER
00190                 DummySpawnManager spawnManager;
00191         #else
00192                 SpawnManager spawnManager;
00193         #endif
00194         SharedDataPtr data;
00195         thread *cleanerThread;
00196         bool done;
00197         condition cleanerThreadSleeper;
00198         
00199         mutex &lock;

00201         ApplicationMap &apps;
00202         unsigned int &max;
00203         unsigned int &count;
00204         unsigned int &active;

00206         bool needsRestart(const string &appRoot) const {
00207                 return false;
00208         }

00210         void cleanerThreadMainLoop() {
00211                 while (!done) {
00212                         mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00213                         
00214                         xtime xt;
00215                         xtime_get(&xt, TIME_UTC);
00216                         xt.sec += CLEAN_INTERVAL;
00217                         cleanerThreadSleeper.timed_wait(l, xt);
00218                         if (done) {
00219                                 break;
00220                         }
00221                         
00222                         ApplicationMap::iterator appsIter;
00223                         time_t now = time(NULL);
00224                         for (appsIter = apps.begin(); appsIter != apps.end(); appsIter++) {
00225                                 ApplicationList &appList(*appsIter->second);
00226                                 ApplicationList::iterator listIter;
00227                                 list<ApplicationList::iterator> elementsToRemove;
00228                                 
00229                                 for (listIter = appList.begin(); listIter != appList.end(); listIter++) {
00230                                         Application &app(**listIter);
00231                                         if (now - app.getLastUsed() > MAX_IDLE_TIME) {
00232                                                 P_TRACE("Cleaning idle app " << app.getAppRoot());
00233                                                 elementsToRemove.push_back(listIter);
00234                                         }
00235                                 }
00236                                 
00237                                 list<ApplicationList::iterator>::iterator it;
00238                                 for (it = elementsToRemove.begin(); it != elementsToRemove.end(); it++) {
00239                                         appList.erase(*it);
00240                                 }
00241                         }
00242                 }
00243         }

00245 public:
00246         StandardApplicationPool(const string &spawnManagerCommand,
00247                      const string &logFile = "",
00248                      const string &environment = "production",
00249                      const string &rubyCommand = "ruby")
00250                 :
00251                 #ifndef PASSENGER_USE_DUMMY_SPAWN_MANAGER
00252                 spawnManager(spawnManagerCommand, logFile, environment, rubyCommand),
00253                 #endif
00254                 data(new SharedData()),
00255                 lock(data->lock),
00256                 countOrMaxChanged(data->countOrMaxChanged),
00257                 apps(data->apps),
00258                 max(data->max),
00259                 count(data->count),
00260                 active(data->active)
00261         {
00262                 done = false;
00263                 max = 100;
00264                 count = 0;
00265                 active = 0;
00266                 cleanerThread = new thread(bind(&StandardApplicationPool::cleanerThreadMainLoop, this));
00267         }
00268         
00269         virtual ~StandardApplicationPool() {
00270                 done = true;
00271                 {
00272                         mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00273                         cleanerThreadSleeper.notify_one();
00274                 }
00275                 cleanerThread->join();
00276                 delete cleanerThread;
00277         }

00279         virtual Application::SessionPtr
00280         get(const string &appRoot, const string &user = "", const string &group = "") {
00281                 /*
00282                  * See "doc/ApplicationPool Algorithm.txt" for a more readable description
00283                  * of the algorithm.
00284                  */
00285                 ApplicationPtr app;
00286                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00287                 
00288                 if (needsRestart(appRoot)) {
00289                         apps.erase(appRoot);
00290                 }
00291                 
00292                 ApplicationMap::iterator it(apps.find(appRoot));
00293                 if (it != apps.end()) {
00294                         ApplicationList &appList(*it->second);
00295                 
00296                         if (appList.front()->getSessions() == 0) {
00297                                 app = appList.front();
00298                                 appList.pop_front();
00299                                 appList.push_back(app);
00300                                 active++;
00301                         } else if (count < max) {
00302                                 app = spawnManager.spawn(appRoot, user, group);
00303                                 appList.push_back(app);
00304                                 count++;
00305                                 countOrMaxChanged.notify_all();
00306                                 active++;
00307                         } else {
00308                                 app = appList.front();
00309                                 appList.pop_front();
00310                                 appList.push_back(app);
00311                                 active++;
00312                         }
00313                 } else {
00314                         while (count >= max) {
00315                                 countOrMaxChanged.wait(l);
00316                         }
00317                         app = spawnManager.spawn(appRoot, user, group);
00318                         ApplicationListPtr appList(new ApplicationList());
00319                         appList->push_back(app);
00320                         apps[appRoot] = appList;
00321                         count++;
00322                         countOrMaxChanged.notify_all();
00323                         active++;
00324                 }
00325                 app->setLastUsed(time(NULL));
00326                 return app->connect(SessionCloseCallback(data, app));
00327         }
00328         
00329         virtual void setMax(unsigned int max) {
00330                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00331                 this->max = max;
00332                 countOrMaxChanged.notify_all();
00333         }
00334         
00335         virtual unsigned int getActive() const {
00336                 return active;
00337         }
00338         
00339         virtual unsigned int getCount() const {
00340                 return count;
00341         }
